intro: Ficus macrocalyx, commonly known as the giant fig tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences called syconia. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments. The fruit, which is edible, is encased in a thick, fibrous husk and is typically consumed when fully ripe.
